entities.name: umbridge
entities.description: Umbridge is a character in the story who is trying to coax Marietta into answering her question. She says 'Come on, now, that won't activate the jinx further'.

entities.name: marietta
entities.description: Marietta is a character in the story who is being questioned by Umbridge. Her eyes are described as looking 'oddly blank'.

entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is a person in the room who Umbridge looks at quickly before asking Marietta another question.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a character in the story who is amazed by Marietta's shaking of her head.

entities.name: mcgonagall
entities.description: McGonagall is a professor who harshly says that Marietta's meaning was clear when she shook her head.

relationships.description: Umbridge is questioning Marietta about whether she has been going to secret meetings for the past six months.
McGonagall clarifies that there have been no secret meetings for the past six months, and Marietta nods in agreement.
